item.title: 美国对冲基金 Verdad 计划推出新的日本小型股基金
item.description: 总部位于波士顿的对冲基金 Verdad Advisers LP 正计划推出一只新的日本股票基金，重点关注小市值公司，这再次表明全球投资者正将目光投向蓝筹股以外的领域，以从日本苏醒的股市中获取额外回报。【原文：Boston-based hedge fund Verdad Advisers LP is planning to launch a new Japanese equity fund focusing on small-cap companies, another sign that global investors are looking beyond blue chips to unlock extra returns from the nation’s reawakened stock market.】

item.title: 英国称仅削减固定收费无法降低能源账单支出
item.description: 能源供应商将被要求至少提供一种固定费用较低的电价。【原文：Energy suppliers will be required to offer at least one tariff with a lower standing charge, a flat daily fee added onto consumer bills to connect to the electricity grid.】

item.title: 特朗普政策推动印度国内股票下注
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）计划对 H-1B 签证征收 100,000 美元的费用，这只是印度国内股票表现优异的又一个理由，因为这些股票受 "美国优先 "议程的影响较小。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s plan to slap a $100,000 fee on H-1B visas is just one more reason to look for outperformance from India’s domestically exposed stocks, which are less vulnerable to the America First agenda.】

item.title: 鲍威尔按兵不动，亚洲市场开局乏力：市场综述
item.description: 在大型科技股下滑终结了标准普尔500指数的三连胜，以及美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）避免就10月降息释放任何信号之后，亚洲股市似乎将以不温不火的态势开盘。【原文：Asian stocks look set for a tepid open after a slide in big tech ended the S&P 500’s three-day winning streak and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell avoided any signals on an October rate cut.】

item.title: 人民币反弹之际，中国国有银行转变美元互换策略
item.description: 中国国有银行正在现货市场上抛售人民币，并用掉期交易来抵消，从而抑制了人民币近期的升值。【原文：Chinese state-owned banks are selling the yuan in the spot market and offsetting their trades with swaps, putting the brakes on a recent rise in the currency.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总统阿尔巴尼塞将于下月在华盛顿与特朗普会晤
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞说，他将于 10 月与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普会面，而就在几个月前，两人在加拿大举行的七国集团会议期间的会谈因以色列与伊朗的冲突而被取消。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said he will meet with President Donald Trump in October, just months after a sit down between the two on the sidelines of a Group of Seven meeting in Canada was canceled due to Israel’s conflict with Iran.】

item.title: 因秘鲁抗议活动，赫德贝关闭康斯坦西亚矿的磨坊
item.description: 赫德贝矿业公司（Hudbay Minerals Inc.【原文：Hudbay Minerals Inc. said it was shutting operations at a mill at its Constancia mine site in Peru because of ongoing political protests.】

item.title: 由剑桥大学出版社支持的 ATRenew 认为，iPhone 17 上市推动了以旧换新的激增
item.description: 中国二手电子产品回收和交易平台 ATRenew Inc.【原文：ATRenew Inc., a Chinese platform for second-hand electronics recycling and trading, expects a sharp rise in consumer trade-ins following Apple Inc.’s iPhone 17 launch.】

item.title: 美国为何利用马格尼茨基法案制裁巴西最高法院大法官的妻子
item.description: 被称为《全球马格尼茨基法案》的法律授权美国总统对被认定参与侵犯人权或腐败的非美国人实施制裁。该法的制裁对象包括俄罗斯监狱当局、缅甸军方官员、南非著名商界领袖以及负责新疆地区事务的中国政府官员。【原文：The law known as the Global Magnitsky Act authorizes the US president to impose sanctions on non-Americans identified as engaging in human rights violations or corruption. It’s been wielded against, among others, Russian prison authorities, officers in Myanmar’s military, prominent South African business leaders, and Chinese government officials responsible for the Xinjiang region.】

item.title: 随着对美联储的担忧减弱，花旗集团退出国债曲线交易
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）的策略师们退出了一项交易建议，他们押注随着对美联储的攻击加剧，较长期的美国债券将表现不佳，并称上周近乎一致的政策决定 "在边际上 "减少了对央行独立性的担忧。【原文：Citigroup Inc. strategists exited a trade recommendation betting that longer-term US bonds would underperform as attacks on the Federal Reserve intensified, saying that a near unanimous policy decision last week reduced concerns about central bank independence ”on the margin.”】

item.title: 新泽西州学区在面临破产威胁后被降级
item.description: 在学校官员威胁要申请破产之后，S&P 全球评级公司将汤姆斯河地区学区的债券评级下调了一个等级。【原文：The Toms River Regional School District had its bond rating dropped one notch by S&P Global Ratings, a move that comes after school officials threatened to file for bankruptcy.】

item.title: 南非称美国贸易协定《非洲增长和机会法》有望继续生效
item.description: 南非贸易部长表示，他希望给予许多非洲国家优惠准入美国市场的贸易协定能在今年晚些时候到期之前得到延长。【原文：South Africa’s trade minister said he was hopeful a trade pact giving many African countries preferential access to the US market will be extended ahead of its expiry later this year.】

item.title: OpenAI 扩展星际之门，在全美新建五个数据中心站点
item.description: OpenAI 计划投资约 4000 亿美元，与甲骨文公司和软银集团公司合作开发五个新的美国数据中心站点，这标志着该公司为兑现早些时候在美国投入 5 万亿美元建设人工智能基础设施的承诺而做出的最大努力。这些计划是由德克萨斯州、新墨西哥州和俄亥俄州的人工智能公司宣布的。【原文：OpenAI plans to invest roughly $400 billion to develop five new US data center sites in partnership with Oracle Corp. and SoftBank Group Corp., marking the biggest push yet to fulfill an earlier pledge to spend a half-trillion dollars on artificial intelligence infrastructure in the country.The new locations, spread across Texas, New Mexico and Ohio, will eventually have a capacity of 7 gigawatts of power, or as much as some cities, the companies said Tuesday. The plans were announced by executi】

item.title: 精神航空削减交易以引入现金并缩小机队规模
item.description: 精神航空控股公司（Spirit Aviation Holdings Inc.【原文：Spirit Aviation Holdings Inc. signed a tentative deal with its biggest aircraft lessor to give back planes it is not flying, reduce an order it previously placed for new aircraft and collect cash the bankrupt airline can use to reorganize.】

item.title: 受关税影响，韩国消费者信心自三月以来首次下滑
item.description: 韩国央行表示，由于担心美国对依赖出口的经济征收更高的关税以及建筑业持续疲软，韩国消费者信心自 3 月份以来首次下降。【原文：South Korea’s consumer confidence dropped for the first time since March, as concerns over higher US tariffs on the export-dependent economy and persistent weakness in construction weighed on sentiment, the central bank said.】

item.title: FAT Brands 和债权人聘请顾问进行重组谈判
item.description: 据知情人士透露，连锁餐厅业主 FAT Brands 公司及其债权人正与顾问合作，讨论对其约 12 亿美元的整体商业证券化债务进行重组的可能性。【原文：Restaurant chain owner FAT Brands Inc. and its creditors are working with advisers to discuss a potential restructuring of its roughly $1.2 billion of whole business securitization debt, according to people with knowledge of the discussions.】

item.title: 美联储意见分歧让债券交易员对冲各种政策结果
item.description: 交易员们正在降低他们对美联储未来几个月降息幅度的预期，这一转变说明了央行官员发出的各种信息是如何混杂在一起，给人们对货币政策的预期蒙上了阴影。【原文：Traders are reducing their expectations for how much the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in the months ahead, a shift that illustrates how mixed messaging from central bank officials has clouded expectations for monetary policy.】

item.title: 英伟达的大规模 OpenAI 交易引发 "循环 "融资担忧
item.description: 在 OpenAI 和 Nvidia 公司帮助掀起全球人工智能狂潮三年之后，这两家公司正联手为一个成本更高的发展阶段铺平道路。【原文：Three years after OpenAI and Nvidia Corp. helped kick off the global artificial intelligence frenzy, the two firms are joining forces to pave the way for a more costly phase of development with a deal that’s quickly revived fears of an AI bubble.】

item.title: 路透社报道美国有意入股后，美洲锂业大涨
item.description: 路透社报道称，特朗普政府在重新谈判能源部贷款条款的同时，正寻求获得多达 10% 的股权，此后，Lithium Americas 公司的股价几乎翻了一番。【原文：Shares of Lithium Americas Corp. nearly doubled after Reuters reported that the Trump administration is seeking an equity stake of as much as 10% while renegotiating terms of the company’s Energy Department loan.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德收购阿里巴巴，时隔四年在中国卷土重来
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的基金四年来首次重开阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）的头寸，正值阿里巴巴因看好中国公司在人工智能领域的发展而股价涨至多年高点之际。【原文：Cathie Wood’s funds reopened positions in Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. for the first time in four years, just as the stock rallied to a multiyear high on optimism over the Chinese firm’s push in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 摩根大通领导的集团探讨为 Advent-Backed Tieup 融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，以摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）为首的一批华尔街银行正在制定一项债务融资协议，以支持Advent International支持的软件企业Xplor Technologies和Clubessential Holdings的合并。【原文：A group of Wall Street banks led by JPMorgan Chase & Co. are working on a debt financing deal to support the Advent International-backed combination of software businesses Xplor Technologies and Clubessential Holdings, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加密货币巨头 Tether 在重大融资中寻求 5000 亿美元估值
item.description: 世界上最大的稳定币发行商 Tether Holdings SA 正在与投资者谈判，希望筹集多达 200 亿美元的资金，这笔交易可能会使这家加密货币公司跻身全球最有价值私营公司的最高行列。【原文：Tether Holdings SA, issuer of the world’s largest stablecoin, is in talks with investors to raise as much as $20 billion, a deal that could propel the crypto firm into the highest ranks of the world’s most valuable private companies.】

item.title: 巴拉圭将关键利率维持在 6%，预计通胀率在目标范围内
item.description: 巴拉圭中央银行将基准利率稳定在 6%，预计今年年底通货膨胀率将保持在目标范围内【原文：Paraguay’s central bank held its benchmark interest rate steady at 6%, forecasting inflation will stay within the target range through the end of the year】

item.description: 波音公司将与 Palantir 科技公司合作，将人工智能整合到当前和未来的国防项目及其工厂中。【原文：Boeing Co. will partner with Palantir Technologies Inc. to integrate artificial intelligence on current and future defense programs and in its factories.】

item.title: 三位美联储官员认为通胀目标区间有优势
item.description: 三位美联储官员在发言中对美国中央银行的通胀目标设定一个范围的想法表示赞同，而不是目前维持的 2% 的硬性目标。【原文：Three Federal Reserve officials spoke favorably of the idea of a range for the US central bank’s inflation target, rather than the hard target of 2% it currently maintains.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦旁遮普省洪水毁坏农作物，水稻减产 9
item.description: 最近的暴雨和洪水毁坏了巴基斯坦旁遮普省约五分之一的水稻作物，而该省的水稻产量约占世界第四大主食出口国的一半。【原文：Recent heavy rains and floods have damaged about one-fifth of the rice crop in Pakistan’s Punjab province, which accounts for about half of the production in the world’s fourth-biggest exporter of the staple.】

item.title: 美国铝业公司首席执行官警告：随着价格上涨，关税将破坏金属需求
item.description: 美国最大的铝生产商负责人警告说，进口关税将破坏对美国金属的需求，这与特朗普政府声称关税将振兴国内产业的说法背道而驰。【原文：The head of the largest US aluminum producer warns import tariffs will destroy demand for American metal, contrary to the Trump administration’s claim duties will revitalize the domestic industry.】
